title: Denorfia is Reds' top Minor Leaguer
subtitle: Denorfia is Reds' top Minor Leaguer
body: CINCINNATI -- As the Reds' rebuilding Minor League system continues to grow, some of the seeds planted in recent years are bearing fruit.  The 2005 season of Chris Denorfia was one example. Denorfia, who worked his way from Double-A to the Majors in one year, was named the winner of the 2005 Sheldon "Chief" Bender Award as the Reds' Minor League Player of the Year.  Denorfia received his award at the 22nd annual LaSalle High School Sports Stag Wednesday night, which was emceed by Reds player development director and LaSalle alum Tim Naehring. Mark Sheldon is a reporter for MLB.com. This story was not subject to the approval of Major League Baseball or its clubs.
author: Mark Sheldon
